e4: Adopting the new policy ensures financial transparency and integrity by eliminating intentional bias in reported earnings. While there may be initial communication challenges, the long-term benefits include increased trust from investors, alignment with ethical standards, and reduced legal risk. Clear communication of the policy change can mitigate potential misunderstandings during the transition.
e5: An ethical reporting policy emphasizes transparency, accuracy, and fairness, presenting financial information truthfully without intentional bias or misleading elements. It should facilitate informed decision-making by investors, maintain trust, and comply with legal and regulatory standards. Effective communication of policy changes and consideration of all stakeholders, including retail investors, form part of an ethical framework.
e6: What communication strategy will be implemented to inform all investors about the policy change and mitigate potential misunderstandings? Have any scenarios been evaluated regarding the impact on stock performance following the change? What measures will be in place to ensure transparency and understanding among all stakeholders, particularly retail investors?
